author: @therandomdot2563
text: The code example was good. I include links to articles I've written on analytics + my github. I don't think anyone clicks on them. Having the code physically in their face as an appendix to the resume seems like a better idea. Issue I'm finding in getting data analyst jobs is companies want someone results-oriented, but the HR filter is hard to bypass when HR asks for a bunch of software / tool skills. I've solved million-dollar problems at companies via analytics, I have an MS in IS, but I don't have 5 yrs experience in SAS, R, etc.. so, don't get calls. It feels humiliating.
